meanings.definition: To suffer a continuous dull pain.
meanings.sent1: After the long hike, my legs ached all night.
meanings.sent2: Her head ached from staring at the screen for too long.
meanings.sent3: His back ached so much, he pretended to be a robot with rusty joints.
meanings.sent4: The old house ached with memories of days gone by.
meanings.sent5: The tree ached with the weight of the heavy snow on its branches.

meanings.definition: To yearn or long for something.
meanings.sent1: She ached for the warmth of the sun on her face during the cold winter.
meanings.sent2: He ached to see his family after being away for so long.
meanings.sent3: The puppy ached for attention, wagging its tail eagerly.
meanings.sent4: Her heart ached for the lost love she could never forget.
meanings.sent5: The artist ached for inspiration, staring at the blank canvas before him.
